concept.title: Application Framework Overview
concept.shortdesc: The Application Framework defines a framework to register and manage applications.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The Application Framework enables native and non-native applications to run on Symbian devices.

section.title: Components
section.p: The Application Framework collection consists of the following components:

li.p: Application Architecture, which provides access to
a cached list of applications, and their properties, on the device.
various mechanisms for launching applications and switching between tasks.
For more information on Application Architecture, refer to Application Architecture Overview.
View server, which is a view-based framework, enables UI applications to have multiple views and supports switching between the views.

section.p: For more information on View Server, refer to View Server Overview.
